Unfortunately, I do not presently have the Haynes on hand.  The Nihon to Ko=
za shows a different first kanji for the signature of two Haruaki, but this=
 would seem to be the most likely hypothesis.

Here are some more pictures.=
 The tsuba has a hakogaki:

http://zincavage.org/GravestoneandRaven.html

 =

  Dear David

  How about Haruaki - see H 0=
0770.0 (or, less probably, H 00771.0) in 
  Haynes' Index of Japanese Sword=
 Fittings and Other Artists.

  Regards, John L.
